document.masterDocTitle: On the Oxypoda species of Turkey and adjacent regions. II. Three new species, additional records, and a checklist (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae, Aleocharinae)

Comment.
Oxypoda lurida
is widespread and common especially in the south of the Western Palaearctic region.
Smetana ( 2004 )
lists the species only from the European part of Turkey , but Zerche ( 1996 ) had already reported it from Antalya province. In Anatolia , its known distribution ranges from Izmir in the northwest to Gaziantep in the east (
Fig. 41
). It has been collected in a variety of habitats at lower to intermediate altitudes ( 0–1170 m ). Almost all the above specimens are females.
